bill.summary: 10/5/1998--Passed House amended. California Indian Land Transfer Act - Transfers all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to specified lands, including improvements and appurtenances, to be held in trust by the United States for the benefit of the following California Indian tribes: (1) the Pit River Tribe; (2) the Fort Independence and Fort Bidwell Communities of Paiute Indians; (3) the Barona Group of Capitan Grande Band of Mission Indians; and (4) the Cuyapaipe, Manzanita, Morongo, and Pala Bands of Mission Indians. Makes available for use by the tribes any rents and royalties from such lands accruing to the United States after enactment of this Act. Terminates grazing preferences on the lands two years after the date of the enactment of this Act.
